messages.subject: Re: RE:[Unschooling-dotcom] World Religions was Pagan friend
messages.msgSnippet: I ll have to go back and look through my papers, I just repulled these from the prior post.  The kidlets were into religions last year and did a bunch of
messages.messageBody:
I'll have to go back and look through my papers, I just repulled these from
the prior post. The kidlets were into religions last year and did a bunch
of research and were rather irritated that they couldn't find numbers for
individuals things (Pagan/Wiccan/Celtic) and the various Chineses
religions. I guess I am responsible for the anti-grouping fixation the
kidlets have <g>

Lynda

----------
> From: Nanci and Thomas Kuykendall <tn-k4of5@...>
> To: unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: RE:[Unschooling-dotcom] World Religions was Pagan friend
> Date: Wednesday, August 23, 2000 10:09 AM
>
> >About a month ago I posted the numbers on these and Christianity is the
> >largest organized religion. Here they are again (in millions):
> >
> >Christianity - 1758.8
> >Moslem - 935
> >Non-religious - 866
> >Hindu - 705
> >Buddhist - 303
> >Atheist - 233
> >Other (includes Pagen/Wiccan, etc.) - 219.3
> >Chinese (Folk reglion) - 180
> >Tribal - 92
> >Jewish - 17.4
> >
> >Lynda
>
> Interesting, where did you get your figures?
>
> Nanci K.
>

messages.messageBody:
>About a month ago I posted the numbers on these and Christianity is the
>largest organized religion. Here they are again (in millions):
>
>Christianity - 1758.8
>Moslem - 935
>Non-religious - 866
>Hindu - 705
>Buddhist - 303
>Atheist - 233
>Other (includes Pagen/Wiccan, etc.) - 219.3
>Chinese (Folk reglion) - 180
>Tribal - 92
>Jewish - 17.4
>
>Lynda

Interesting, where did you get your figures?

Nanci K.
